#41

How did it work? How did 'sales' occur?

When I played there was a survey monkey where you voted for a bunch of newly released and existing singles and a couple of albums, then the singles charts were made up using the votes, and the album charts were decided by a mix of the singles charts and the votes for albums.

Doing chart algorithms before it was cool.

AGinAg (39)

Was it anonymous back then?

Not specifically but it was a bit like Moopy where you had a username in the forum, usually the name of your artist. But we also had a CHAT ROOM (this was back in 2001!) where people could converse 'normally'.

#59

It's the most 2001 thing ever.

I wonder how we could update to 2020.

I'm having all sorts of ideas but they're all a bit COMPLICATED. But people could create an alias of their artist, maybe who could only post in a Uramoopstar sub-forum if that's possible...Have a bit of time to come up with a single/album cover and tracklist, then a launch after which we have a week to 'promote', and then there's a vote at the end of the week for a one-off chart, with a reveal with who was which artist.

The trouble with it always was that it was a bit of WORK though and we're not teenagers with lots of free time any more (except @Soldi)
